examples.title: Label Symbol 3D with verticalOffset and leader line callout

description: LabelSymbol3D is used to render labels for features from a FeatureLayer in a 3D SceneView.
title: LabelSymbol3D

___symbolLayers.description: A Collection of Symbol3DLayer objects used to visualize the graphic or feature.

$eref.description: Symbol layer for text and font definitions.
$eref.title: TextSymbol3DLayer

___text.description: Text content in the label. Typically this property is not set, as text content is read from labeling field.

___type.description: Specifies the type of symbol used.

___size.description: Font size in points, positive only

___type.description: Specifies the type of symbol used.
The type of the callout. A callout of type `line` connects an offset symbol or label with its location.

___size.description: The width of the line in points.

___transparency.description: A value between `100` (full transparency) and `0` (full opacity).

$eref.description: Shifts the symbol along the vertical world axis by a given length. The length is set in screen space units.
$eref.title: verticalOffset

___minWorldLength.description: The minimum vertical symbol lift in world units. It acts as a lower bound to avoid lift becoming too small.

___screenLength.description: Maximal screen length of lift in points.

___maxWorldLength.description: The maximum vertical symbol lift in world units. It acts as an upper bound to avoid lift becoming too big.
